Data.event_text: 9  The 2022 Alberta Scotties Tournament of Hearts and 2022 Boston Pizza Cup are held in Grande Prairie, Alberta, with Laura Walker winning the former and Kevin Koe winning the latter.[citation needed]
An official death toll from COVID-19 in Canada exceeds 30,000 people.[citation needed]
9  The 2022 Saskatchewan Scotties Tournament of Hearts is held in Assiniboia, Saskatchewan, with Penny Barker winning the competition.[citation needed]
Conversion therapy becomes illegal in the country.

links.text: -Aiello, Rachel (January 7, 2022). "Conversion therapy is now illegal in Canada". CTV News. Retrieved January 8, 2022.-

Data.event_text: The number of daily COVID-19 infections in Canada exceeds 55,350 people for the first time since the pandemic begin, fueled by highly transmissible Deltacron hybrid variant.[citation needed]
An explosion kills six people in an industrial suburb of Ottawa, Ontario.

links.text: -Pritchard, Trevor (January 21, 2022). "United in death, Ottawa explosion victims all stood out in life". CBC News. Archived from the original on 2022-01-21. Retrieved January 23, 2022.-
-Pritchard, Trevor (January 21, 2022). "United in death, Ottawa explosion victims all stood out in life". CBC News. Archived from the original on 2022-01-21. Retrieved January 23, 2022.-
-"Human remains located at site of explosion on Merivale Road, officials say - Ottawa". Global News. Retrieved 2022-01-23.-
-"Eastway explosion: A timeline of a disaster and the days that followed". Ottawa Citizen. Retrieved 2022-01-23.-

Data.event_text: The number of daily COVID-19 Deltacron infections has peaked in Canada.[citation needed]
Analog service is discontinued for all TV stations.

links.text: -"Digital Television (DTV) Transition Schedule" (PDF). Innovation, Science and Economic Development Canada. April 2017.-

Data.event_text: The four members of the Patel family froze to death near Emerson, Manitoba.

links.text: -"The family that froze to death a world away from home". BBC News. 2022-02-11. Retrieved 2023-01-17.-

Data.event_text: The Freedom Convoy, a series of protests over vaccination mandates, occurs throughout the country.[citation needed]
Erin O'Toole is removed as the leader of the Conservative Party. He was ousted after losing a leadership review from the party's MPs. Candice Bergen is chosen as the party's interim leader.

links.text: -Cousins, Ben (February 2, 2022). "Conservatives name Candice Bergen as interim leader after O'Toole voted out". CTV News. Retrieved February 2, 2022.-

Data.event_text: The 2022 British Columbia Liberal Party leadership election is held. Kevin Falcon is declared the winner.

links.text: -Pawson, Chad (7 February 2022). "New B.C. Liberal Leader Kevin Falcon to run in Vancouver-Quilchena as former leader steps down". CBC News. Retrieved 3 January 2024.-

Data.event_text: The Platinum Jubilee of Elizabeth II's accession as Queen of Canada occurs.[citation needed]
Prime Minister Justin Trudeau invokes the Emergencies Act for the first time in Canadian history, in response to the Freedom Convoy.

links.text: -Aiello, Rachel (14 February 2022). "Trudeau makes history, invokes Emergencies Act to address trucker protests". CTV News. Retrieved 31 December 2023.-

Data.event_text: Villa de Pitanxo, a Spanish fishing trawler, capsizes off the coast of Newfoundland and Labrador, killing 21 people.[citation needed]
2022 Athabasca provincial by-election - The Saskatchewan Party wins a seat in Northern Saskatchewan for the first time.[citation needed]
Ryan Meili announces his pending resignation as leader of the Saskatchewan New Democratic Party. He will stay on as leader, until his successor is chosen.[citation needed]
The Emergencies Act is revoked by Justin Trudeau as the Freedom Convoy movement ends.

links.text: -"Trudeau revokes emergency powers after Canada blockades end". NPR. Associated Press. 2022-02-23. Retrieved 2022-02-26.-

Data.event_text: In a data published by Statistics Canada, around 337,000 jobs have been added in , dropping the jobless rate down to 5.5 per cent, the lowest in Canada since , a month prior to the COVID-19 pandemic and recession.

links.text: -Evans, Pete (11 March 2022). "Canada added 337,000 jobs last month, twice what was expected". CBC News. Archived from the original on 4 Apr 2023.-
-Evans, Pete (11 March 2022). "Canada added 337,000 jobs last month, twice what was expected". CBC News. Archived from the original on 4 Apr 2023.-

Data.event_text: In a data published by Statistics Canada, around 337,000 jobs have been added in February 2022, dropping the jobless rate down to 5.5 per cent, the lowest in Canada since February 2020, a month prior to the COVID-19 pandemic and recession.

links.text: -Evans, Pete (11 March 2022). "Canada added 337,000 jobs last month, twice what was expected". CBC News. Archived from the original on 4 Apr 2023.-
-Evans, Pete (11 March 2022). "Canada added 337,000 jobs last month, twice what was expected". CBC News. Archived from the original on 4 Apr 2023.-

Data.event_text: The Canada men's national soccer team defeated Jamaica to qualify for the 2022 FIFA World Cup, ending a 36-year drought since the first and only time Canada played in the FIFA World Cup, in 1986.[citation needed]

The National Hockey League announces that the upcoming Winnipeg Jets game against the Seattle Kraken, originally scheduled for , has been postponed to  as a winter storm sweeps through the southern area of Manitoba.

links.text: -"Kraken-Jets game postponed due to winter storm". 12 April 2022.-

Data.event_text: After a 23-game winning streak, Mattea Roach, a tutor from Toronto, loses on Jeopardy! to Danielle Maurer. Roach won a total of $560,983 (US). As of May 2022[update], she was the most successful Canadian to play on the show and ranks 5th in all-time regular season wins.

links.text: -Haring, Bruce (May 6, 2022). "'Jeopardy!' Champion Mattea Roach's Bid For 24th Consecutive Win Comes Down To $1". Deadline. Retrieved May 7, 2022.-
-Thomas, Stephanie (11 April 2023). "23-time Jeopardy winner returns to Calgary". CTV News. Retrieved 4 January 2024.-
-"Track Leaderboard of Legends". Jeopardy.com. Retrieved 4 January 2024.-

Data.event_text: An official death toll from COVID-19 in Canada exceeds 40,000 people since the start of the pandemic.
The Toronto Maple Leafs lose game 7, 2-1, to the Tampa Bay Lightning, extending the Stanley Cup championship drought to 55 years. The drought surpasses the New York Rangers 54-year drought.

links.text: -"Column: Maple Leafs now at 55 years since last championship". ABC News.-

Data.event_text: The Juno Awards of 2022 are held in Toronto, Ontario.

links.text: -Cardin, Charlotte (15 May 2022). "Juno Awards 2022: Full list of winners". CBC News. Retrieved 2 January 2024.-

Data.event_text: 19  Charles, Prince of Wales and Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall tour the country. The tour mainly focuses on reconciliation with Indigenous people.

links.text: -"Prince Charles offers remarks about reconciliation as Canadian tour begins". CTV News. May 17, 2022. Retrieved May 18, 2022.-

Data.event_text: The first case of monkeypox was confirmed in Toronto.

links.text: -"Monkeypox outbreak: Canada now has 77 confirmed cases | Globalnews.ca".-

Data.event_text: An extreme derecho formed in Sarnia, Ontario and continued through the Quebec City-Windsor corridor, causing widespread power outages and damage, affecting 900,000 people, and killing 11.

links.text: -"What's a derecho and why is it so destructive? The science behind this powerful storm". CBC News.-

Data.event_text: Quebec's French Language Bill 96 is adopted, with 78 MNAs in favour (from the CAQ and Québec solidaire) and 29 against (from the Liberal Party and Parti Québécois).

links.text: -"Language law Bill 96 adopted, promising sweeping changes for Quebec". Montreal. 2022-05-24. Retrieved 2022-05-25.-

Data.event_text: The 2022 Ontario general election is held, with the Progressive Conservative Party winning a majority government. Andrea Horwath announces her pending resignation as the leader of the New Democratic Party. Steven Del Duca also announces his pending resignation as the leader of the Liberal Party.

links.text: -Benzie, Robert (June 2, 2022). "Doug Ford trounces the competition as Steven Del Duca and Andrea Horwath resign as party leaders". Toronto Star. Retrieved June 3, 2022.-

Data.event_text: Alek Minassian, the perpetrator of the Toronto van attack, is sentenced to life in prison without the possibility of parole for 25 years.

links.text: -Carter, Adam (June 13, 2022). "Toronto van attacker sentenced to life in prison, no possibility of parole for 25 years". CBC.ca. Retrieved June 15, 2022.-

Data.event_text: Canada and Denmark end their competing claims for Hans Island by dividing the island roughly in half ending what was referred to as the Whisky War.

links.text: -"Whisky Wars: Denmark and Canada strike deal to end 50-year row over Arctic island". BBC News. 14 June 2022. Archived from the original on 2022-06-15. Retrieved 2022-06-17.-
-"Whisky Wars: Denmark and Canada strike deal to end 50-year row over Arctic island". BBC News. 14 June 2022. Archived from the original on 2022-06-15. Retrieved 2022-06-17.-

Data.event_text: Two Canadian venues  BC Place in Vancouver and BMO Field in Toronto – were announced by FIFA as two of the sixteen venues for the 2026 World Cup.

links.text: -O'Connor-Clarke, Charlie (June 26, 2022). "Toronto, Vancouver named Canadian host cities for 2026 FIFA World Cup". Retrieved September 1, 2022.-

Data.event_text: A shootout occurs between two suspects and responding police officers following a botched robbery of a Bank of Montreal branch in Saanich, British Columbia. Both suspects are killed by police, while six officers are injured.

links.text: -Coyne, Todd (June 29, 2022). "'What were they waiting for?' Woman inside Saanich bank amid shootout describes 'calm' gunmen". CTV News Vancouver Island. Retrieved June 30, 2022.-
-Judd, Amy (June 28, 2022). "'Standing there with an assault rifle': Hostage describes scene of B.C. bank robbery". Global News. Retrieved June 30, 2022.-

Data.event_text: Telecom provider Rogers Communications experiences a major service outage, affecting more than 12 million users.

links.text: -"Ottawa announces it will require telecoms to provide backup for each other during outages following Rogers system failure". Toronto Star. July 11, 2022. Retrieved August 24, 2022.-

Data.event_text: 29  Pope Francis visits the country, stopping at Edmonton in Alberta, Quebec City in Quebec, and Iqaluit in Nunavut.

links.text: -"Governor General to take part in the visit of His Holiness Pope Francis". The Governor General of Canada. July 21, 2022. Retrieved August 24, 2022.-

Data.event_text: Multiple shootings occur in Langley, British Columbia. Three people were killed, including the perpetrator, while two others were injured.

links.text: -"3 dead, including suspect, after multiple shootings in Langley". CBC News. July 25, 2022. Retrieved August 24, 2022.-

Data.event_text: Susan Holt wins the 2022 New Brunswick Liberal Association leadership election.

links.text: -"Susan Holt elected as New Brunswick Liberal leader". CBC News New Brunswick, August 6, 2022.-

Data.event_text: A stabbing spree occurs in Saskatchewan, killing 11 people and injuring 18 others.

links.text: -Djuric, Mickey (2022-09-04). "RCMP searching for suspects after 10 dead, 15 injured in Saskatchewan stabbings". CP24. Retrieved 2022-09-05.-

Data.event_text: 18  The 2022 Toronto International Film Festival is held.

links.text: -Kohn, Eric (September 9, 2022). "TIFF Opens with A24, Netflix, and Apple's Bids for Oscar and Commercial Success". IndieWire. Retrieved September 9, 2022.-

Data.event_text: Charles III becomes King of Canada following the death of Queen Elizabeth II.

links.text: -"King Charles III, the new monarch". BBC News. 2022-09-09. Retrieved 2022-09-10.-

Data.event_text: Charles III is officially proclaimed King of Canada at a ceremony at Rideau Hall.

links.text: -"King Charles III officially proclaimed Canada's head of state at Rideau Hall ceremony". Archived from the original on 2022-11-14. Retrieved 2022-11-14.-
-"King Charles III officially proclaimed Canada's head of state at Rideau Hall ceremony". Archived from the original on 2022-11-14. Retrieved 2022-11-14.-

Data.event_text: Pierre Poilievre wins the 2022 Conservative Party of Canada leadership election, becoming the leader of the Conservative Party and the leader of the Official Opposition.

links.text: -"Pierre Poilievre wins Conservative leadership on first ballot". CTVNews. 2022-09-10. Archived from the original on 24 Jan 2023. Retrieved 2022-09-11.-
-"Pierre Poilievre wins Conservative leadership on first ballot". CTVNews. 2022-09-10. Archived from the original on 24 Jan 2023. Retrieved 2022-09-11.-

Data.event_text: A national day of mourning occurs in Canada for the late Queen Elizabeth II with a federal holiday and a National Commemorative Service in Ottawa.

links.text: -"Trudeau announces 'federal holiday' for Queen's funeral, but here's who'll actually have the day off". 13 September 2022. Archived from the original on 2022-11-14. Retrieved 2022-11-14.-
-"Trudeau announces 'federal holiday' for Queen's funeral, but here's who'll actually have the day off". 13 September 2022. Archived from the original on 2022-11-14. Retrieved 2022-11-14.-

Data.event_text: Canadian representatives attend the funeral of Queen Elizabeth II in London.

links.text: -"Canadians who will be at the Queen's funeral: list of delegates released". 12 September 2022. Archived from the original on 2022-11-14. Retrieved 2022-11-14.-
-"Canadians who will be at the Queen's funeral: list of delegates released". 12 September 2022. Archived from the original on 2022-11-14. Retrieved 2022-11-14.-

Data.event_text: Nathaniel Teed wins the 2022 Saskatoon Meewasin provincial by-election.

links.text: -"Saskatoon elects first openly gay MLA, Nathaniel Teed - Saskatoon | Globalnews.ca". Global News. Retrieved 2022-09-29.-

Data.event_text: The Coalition Avenir Québec wins a majority government in the 2022 Quebec general election.

links.text: -"'More proud! More rich!': Legault wins 2022 Quebec election with a majority government". Montreal. 2022-10-03. Retrieved 2022-10-04.-

Data.event_text: Bill Hogan becomes Minister of Education and Early Childhood Development in the Executive Council of New Brunswick, replacing Dominic Cardy who resigned.

links.text: -"Cardy resigns as N.B. education minister, sends scorching letter to premier". ca.news.yahoo.com. 13 October 2022. Retrieved 2022-10-15.-

Data.event_text: The 2022 British Columbia municipal elections are held.

links.text: -"B.C. Votes 2022: What you need to know about today's municipal elections". CBC. 15 October 2022. Retrieved 15 October 2022.-

Data.event_text: Travis Patron, former leader of the Canadian Nationalist Party, is sentenced to one year in jail for wilfully promoting hatred against Jewish people and ordered to refrain from posting about them for a year after the sentence ends.

links.text: -Zakreski, Dan (October 20, 2022). "Former Canadian Nationalist Party leader Travis Patron sentenced to 1 year for promoting hatred against Jews". CBC News. Archived from the original on 21 Feb 2023. Retrieved October 20, 2022.-

-Zakreski, Dan (October 20, 2022). "Former Canadian Nationalist Party leader Travis Patron sentenced to 1 year for promoting hatred against Jews". CBC News. Archived from the original on 21 Feb 2023. Retrieved October 20, 2022.-

Data.event_text: The 2022 Ontario municipal elections are held.

links.text: -Cook, Dustin; Gray, Jeff (2022-10-24). "Ontario municipal elections 2022: Here are the winners of the major mayoral races". The Globe and Mail. Archived from the original on 6 Nov 2022. Retrieved 2022-10-26.-

-Cook, Dustin; Gray, Jeff (2022-10-24). "Ontario municipal elections 2022: Here are the winners of the major mayoral races". The Globe and Mail. Archived from the original on 6 Nov 2022. Retrieved 2022-10-26.-

Data.event_text: Elizabeth May wins the 2022 Green Party of Canada leadership election, becoming the leader of the Green Party again since resigning in 2019.

links.text: -Pass-Lang, Christian (21 November 2022). "Elizabeth May wins Green Party of Canada leadership, set to co-lead with Jonathan Pedneault". CBC News. Retrieved 3 January 2024.-
-Major, Darren (9 November 2022). "Green leadership candidates tout plans to revitalize party in debate". CBC News. Retrieved 3 January 2024.-

Data.event_text: The 109th Grey Cup Game in Regina, Saskatchewan, was won by the Toronto Argonauts, 2423, against two-time defending champion Winnipeg Blue Bombers.[citation needed]
The Coalition Avenir Québec led by François Legault government tables a bill that would make Oath of Allegiance to the King optional for MNAs.

links.text: -"CAQ tables bill to get rid of mandatory oath to King in Quebec". CBC News. Archived from the original on 6 Jan 2023.-
-"CAQ tables bill to get rid of mandatory oath to King in Quebec". CBC News. Archived from the original on 6 Jan 2023.-
-"CAQ bill would make oath to King optional for Quebec MNAs".-

Data.event_text: The Alberta Sovereignty Within a United Canada Act, which grants the cabinet of Alberta the ability to nullify national laws, passes the Albertan legislature by a party line vote of 277, following significant opposition by the Alberta New Democratic Party and Indigenous chiefs.

links.text: -Bennett, Dean (8 Dec 2022). "Alberta passes Sovereignty Act, but first strips out sweeping powers for cabinet". CBC News. Archived from the original on 24 Mar 2023.-
-Bennett, Dean (8 Dec 2022). "Alberta passes Sovereignty Act, but first strips out sweeping powers for cabinet". CBC News. Archived from the original on 24 Mar 2023.-

Data.event_text: The Coalition Avenir Québec government bill that would make the Oath of Allegiance optional for MNAs passes unanimously.

links.text: -"Quebec adopts law making oath to King optional for elected members". 9 December 2022.-
-Banerjee, Sidhartha (9 Dec 2022). "Quebec adopts law making oath to King optional for elected members". CBC News. Archived from the original on 6 Feb 2023.-
-Banerjee, Sidhartha (9 Dec 2022). "Quebec adopts law making oath to King optional for elected members". CBC News. Archived from the original on 6 Feb 2023.-
-"Quebec ends mandatory oath to King Charles for elected officials". Reuters. 9 December 2022.-
-"Quebec ends mandatory oath to King Charles for elected officials". 9 December 2022.-

Data.event_text: A mass shooting occurs in a condominium tower in Vaughan, Ontario. Six people are killed, including the perpetrator.

links.text: -Victims in Vaughan, Ont., mass shooting include 3 members of condo board, police say-

Data.event_text: Eight teenage girls fatally stab one man in Toronto.
Single-use plastics are banned from being manufactured or imported in the country.

links.text: -"Canada's single-use plastic ban takes effect on Dec. 20. Here's what to know". MSN. Retrieved 2022-12-20.-
